reviews.review: Started slow but then got better
Save your theater money. This is a redbox movie. Easy to watch for a relaxing night. Not much drama, some language.
I enjoyed the movie with family great over all movie
Kept you guessing. Good dialogue. Good actors!
A real good 'who dunnit' with lots of plot twists to keep you guessing.  Great cast with some good acting.  Daniel Craig is very good - didn't see 007 in his performance once!
Knives Out was INCREDIBLE! Excellent cast, great comedy and surprising twists that keep you intrigued the whole film.

The sign of a great movie: no phones out, no talking, everyone in the audience was completely engrossed by the terrific script and superb cast. A throwback to the days of Sherlock Holmes and Agatha Christie where any or all of the characters could be the murdered. Loved it!
Intrigue with a side order of humor. Itâ€™s an excellent comedic who-done-it.

After breaking the fandom with the ridiculous "The Last Jedi", Johnson shows that he can indeed direct a great movie! Very well done, even if the characters are all caricatures of real people, with clever writing and wonderful pacing, "Knives Out" is a lot of fun! Highly recommended!

The only way you'd call this "the perfect whodunnit" is if you've never seen a whodunnit before.
I'll keep it brief for now, but I'll be back later.
Every character's motive is explored in the beginning of the film, but then they're almost immediately rendered irrelevant. A large portion of the cast eventually becomes completely inconsequential to the plot.
None of the characters are given backstories and no given information was enough to make me care about them.
All the so-called "twists and turns" fall flat and the element of surprise played no part in the viewing experience.
I won't deny that it has entertaining elements, but the only way for me to enjoy these was to completely disregard about 80% of the movie.
This is my opinion and if you disagree with it I genuinely wish I could see it the way you do.
